oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Transition metalâ€“saccharide chemistry: synthesis, characterization and solution stability studies of cis-dioxomolybdenum saccharide complexes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MUKHOPADHYAY, ANINDITA
KARKAMKAR, ABHIJEET
KOLEHMAINEN, ERKKI
RAO, CHEBROLU P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cyclic voltammetry
spectrometers
circular dichroism
thermal analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Six cis-dioxomolybdenum(VI) complexes of simple monosaccharides (D-glucose, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-mannose, D-ribose and D-xylose) have been synthesized and characterized by a variety of analytical and spectral methods. Both the solution and solid-state studies have supported the presence of dimeric structures, formed through the cis-MoO2 moieties and the bridging saccharide units. Solution stability of these complexes as a function of time has also been addressed.
